CommentsContent: I wanted a small format laptop that was high quality and powerful. I decided on a Macbook Air. I had no experience with Mac computers but luckily I have a friend who helped me make the right decision. Probably the most important thing to verify when buying a used mac is the year of manufacture. The year will be in a format like "Early 2015". This will determine the OS you can run on the unit. For example, anything Early 2013 or higher will run "Big Sur" the latest OS. Apple's website will tell you what the highest OS you can run on any given Mac. Secondly is battery health. A Macbook air battery is rated at 1000 cycles. Look in the system info screen to see the battery health. It should say "normal" with a number of cycles well less than 1000. Any less and your battery may have to be replaced soon and it's not easy for the casual user. Third is third party apps like MS Office which may or may not run on newer OS versions. For example, Office 2016 will run on Catalina but not on Big Sur. But on th bright side this a awesome laptop. Build quality is excellent with an aluminum case, nice keyboard, Nice touchpad and just an overall feel of quality.
